newsitem.title: USA: Humana to sell Washington health plan.
newsitem.headline: Humana to sell Washington health plan.

text.p: Humana Inc said on Friday that Humana Group Health Plan Inc signed a non-binding letter of intent for Kaiser Permanente Mid-Atlantic States Region to acquire certain assets and liabilities of Humana's Washington D.C.-based health plan.
Terms of the agreement were not disclosed.
Consummation of the deal is subject to successful negotiation of a definitive agreement and regulatory approvals, the company said.
Humana Group Health is a wholly-owned subsidiary of Humana Inc.
Kaiser is a non-profit health plan that serves the Baltimore, Md., and Washington, D.C. metropolitan areas. It is part of the Kaiser Permanente Medical Care Program.
